Comments_List: Music theory. How to use Supercollider to compose? A new taste of computer music.
Music concepts, supercollider knowledge
How to use Supercollider and creative tools for music composition.
Markoff chains, etc for algorithmic composition
I have acquired the principles of music composition, the skills to use computer to write music and a perspective on computational creativity.
how to compose computer musics
Many different systems to generate computer music.

Strength: really fun!

Weakness: N/A
Its a special course, but have some changes in the middle, I think it can be more strict

This course is a good overview of different techniques and well balanced in the theoretical vs programming ratio. It could be improved by having some more precise explanations of the theoretical tools: for instance, the set theory presentation was a little fuzzy.

More organized content and more assignments.

I felt we couldve started markoff chains right at the first half of the class and have more in depth study on different methods. We could also have assignments on using arduino and the different tools available in the studio. All in all, make the workload higher!

Open-mindedness is the strength of this course. Project topic selection is open-ended and each student has the freedom to choose the topic that fits himself/herself. Students of different purposes take this course and everyone feel it fruitful.

strengths: not so many students enrolled, high engagement
weaknesses: need strong music background for some tasks

Strength: covers a lot of different systems.

Weakness: Homework only really covered Markov Chains, so for me the rest of the systems arent as deeply understood as Markov Chains.

Improvements: maybe include more state-of-the-art systems used by current artists. (I heard an AI helped compose an album recently)
Yes, it is a special designed CS course. Take it!
If that guy love music, I will say yes
Felt I learned a lot of valuable stuff! So yes!

Yes! This course is suitable for all kinds of students who are interested in music or computational intelligence. Both music or computer science students can learn a lot from this course and the collaboration with each other.
Yes. It's a very good and interesting class overall.
Yes. A good course overall. In addition to computer music, I get to know more about creativity in general.
